intro_page.submission_title: Broking Submission for Precision Components Manufacturing Ltd

risk_overview.introduction:
Pemberton Risk Solutions is pleased to present this renewal submission for Precision Components Manufacturing Ltd, a well-established and expertly managed precision engineering business. We have represented this client for the past eight years, during which time they have demonstrated exceptional risk management practices and maintained a near loss-free claims record. The risk is being marketed to secure competitive terms at renewal and to explore enhanced coverage options in line with the company's recent expansion into their new facility in Nottingham.

Precision Components Manufacturing Ltd operates as a respected supplier of high-precision machined components to the automotive and aerospace sectors. Their commitment to quality, evidenced by multiple ISO certifications and long-standing blue-chip client relationships, positions them as an exemplary manufacturing risk. The business has invested significantly in modern machinery, fire protection systems, and comprehensive staff training programmes.
risk_overview.business_description: Manufacturer of precision-engineered metal components for automotive and aerospace industries, specialising in CNC machining, turning, and grinding operations

covers.limit: £5,000,000 Limit of Indemnity, Products Liability included

risk_management.summary: Precision Components Manufacturing Ltd demonstrates exemplary risk management across all operational areas. The business benefits from highly experienced senior management with an average tenure of 15 years, ensuring continuity and deep operational knowledge.

Long-standing contracts with Tier 1 automotive suppliers including Jaguar Land Rover and BMW UK
Approved supplier status with Rolls-Royce Aerospace division since 2005
Annual third-party risk assessments conducted by Marsh Risk Consulting
Comprehensive business continuity plan tested annually
Investment of £2.1m in new CNC machinery and fire protection systems over past 3 years

employers_liability.description: Precision Components Manufacturing Ltd employs 127 full-time equivalent staff across its three locations. The workforce is stable with low turnover, and average length of service exceeds 8 years. All manufacturing staff complete comprehensive induction training including machinery operation, health and safety procedures, and emergency response protocols. The company maintains an excellent health and safety record with zero RIDDOR reportable incidents in the past 3 years.
risk_management: Full-time HSE Manager (NEBOSH Diploma qualified) with support from external HSE consultant (quarterly visits)
All machinery fitted with appropriate guarding to latest CE/UKCA standards
Machine-specific risk assessments for all operations reviewed annually
Comprehensive PPE policy with free provision of safety boots, glasses, gloves and hearing protection
Annual hearing tests and health surveillance for at-risk workers
Manual handling training for all relevant staff
Near-miss reporting system with investigation and corrective action process
Safety committee meets monthly with employee representatives
Regular safety audits and inspections with action tracking
Occupational health service available including physiotherapy and mental health support

wageroll_breakdown.description: Office-based staff including finance, sales, procurement, HR and management
CNC machine operators, setters and programmers working in controlled manufacturing environment
Manual lathe and grinding machine operators, toolmakers
Forklift drivers, goods-in/out operatives, packing staff

public_and_products_liability.description: Precision Components Manufacturing Ltd produces high-precision machined metal components primarily for the automotive and aerospace sectors. Products are manufactured to exact customer specifications with rigorous quality control at each production stage. The company holds Tier 1 approved supplier status with major automotive OEMs and aerospace manufacturers, requiring compliance with demanding quality standards. All finished components are inspected using coordinate measuring machines (CMM) and certified before dispatch.
product_details: Products: Precision machined components including shafts, housings, gears and bespoke parts manufactured from steel, aluminium and specialist alloys
End customers: Primarily Tier 1 automotive suppliers (Jaguar Land Rover, BMW UK, ZF Friedrichshafen) and aerospace companies (Rolls-Royce, GKN Aerospace, Collins Aerospace)
Quality standards: ISO 9001:2015, IATF 16949:2016 (automotive), AS9100 Rev D (aerospace)
Product testing: 100% dimensional inspection, material traceability, first article inspection protocols, documented inspection records retained for 10 years
supply_chain: Raw materials: 85% sourced from UK and European steel stockholders (British Steel, Tata Steel, Thyssenkrupp), 15% from specialist alloy suppliers
All materials supplied with mill certificates and material traceability
Approved supplier list maintained with annual supplier audits for critical materials
No products sourced from outside EEA
site_access_control: Visitor sign-in procedure with safety induction and PPE provision
Designated visitor walkways separated from manufacturing areas
Contractor permit to work system for all maintenance activities
Loading bay segregation from pedestrian areas

liability_covers.liability_claims_summary: Excellent claims history with only three minor claims in past 5 years, all promptly addressed with corrective actions. No products liability claims ever recorded. No outstanding or intimated claims.

additional_information.broker_recommendation: Pemberton Risk Solutions strongly recommends this risk as an excellent manufacturing account. The insured demonstrates exemplary risk management, maintains comprehensive safety and quality systems, and has an outstanding claims history. The recent investments in fire protection and security further enhance the quality of this risk. We recommend competitive terms reflecting the quality of this account.
additional_information.marketing_notes: This submission is being presented to a select panel of quality insurers. The expiring premium is £46,800. We are seeking competitive quotations to include long-term agreement consideration. The insured is open to consideration of increased deductibles for improved terms.
